title: Descr of a Mexican Textile Factory 1629 Q3

content.prompt: In the period 1450â€“1750, the most significant difference between economic production in the Americas, as described in the passage, and economic production in the Indian Ocean was that, unlike in the Americas,

choices.label: native artisans and merchants continued to dominate economic production in the Indian Ocean
Europeans dominated economic production by establishing industrial manufacturing centers in the Indian Ocean
European domination of economic production in the Indian Ocean depended on large-scale colonization
native merchants in the Indian Ocean were greatly impoverished by the flood of cheap European textile exports into their communities

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
